# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    # Regular expressions to match Question and Answer sections
    question_re = r"^# Question\s*?(.*)"m
    answer_re = r"^# Answer\s*?(.*)"m

    # Initialize the results as an empty tuple
    results = Tuple{String, String}()

    # Iterate over each line of the markdown text
    for line in split(md, "\n")
        # Check if the line starts a Question section
        m = match(question_re, line)
        if m !== nothing
            # If so, save the question text and continue to the next line
            question = strip(m[1])
            continue
        end

        # Check if the line starts an Answer section
        m = match(answer_re, line)
        if m !== nothing
            # If so, save the answer text and add the result to the tuple
            answer = strip(readuntil(md, "\n", from=position(md, m[0])))
            results = (question, answer)::Tuple{String, String}
            continue
        end
    end

    # Return the extracted question and answer
    return results
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to match lines that start with `# Question` and `# Answer`. It then extracts the text following these headers by iterating over the lines of the markdown text and stripping any leading whitespace and newlines. The result is returned as a tuple containing the question and answer.
